answers.answer: Thanks for your reply, sailor's wife.  I have had some tests for diabetes but I seem to be ok.  I'm starting to wonder if it's my seat belt in my car because it does rub that spot, so I'm putting the seat belt under my left arm to try to avoid that. Thanks for writing.
i had a breast reduction 2 months ago put some creams that have victamin c and taking vitiamins helps to, another thing is if you have question the best person to talk to is your surgeon.
i also put the top of the seat belt behind my back

Thank you so much for your comment, redheadwife.  I've tried a cream with vitamin E so I'll try one with vitamin C.  And I've asked my surgeon about it, but he's not all that helpful. I may seek the help of either a dermatologist or a plastic surgeon.
Aloe Vera is the cream that is helpig me out alot and take vitiamins along with that. Also to you exercize cause that helps your helping to cause it makes you healthy all the way around.

question: I was hoping someone could offer some suggestions. I had a surgical breast biopsy last year because of suspicious tissue. Fortunately, all is well for now. But the incision on my breast is not healing well and is red and painful. It's been a whole year and I thought the pain would be gone by now and that the redness on the incision would have faded. Thanks for any suggestions you could give.
title: scar that will not heal
